snippet: A new wave of Greek wines is now available in the United States; the panel tasted 20 reds from recent vintages.
abstract: Eric Asimov Wines of The Times column on the new wave of Greek red wines now available in the United States. Photo (M)0
lead_paragraph: MAVROTRAGANO and mandelaria; limnio and vlahiko; and of course, agiorgtiko and xinomavro. I know: it's all Greek. That's what is so exciting. These indigenous red grapes represent a new wave of Greek wines now available in the United States. While whites remain the most familiar Greek wines (it's wonderful this year to see more restaurants serving assyrtiko by the glass), Greece also offers a fascinating extension of the spectrum of world reds.
